column16: Ballot Comment

column14: "This Implementation Guide contains guidance, new logical models, profiles and extensions to implement support for Occupational Data for Health (ODH). ODH is primarily designed to facilitate clinical care, including population health; ODH also can be used to support public health reporting, population health, and similar value-based care. ODH is not designed to support billing activities."
column16: This IG does not contain any guidance on how to use the artifacts in the IG to meet the stated objectives.  For example there is a composition artifact defined.  Should that be transacted as a FHIR document or using a FHIR RESTful approach.  Could I create a panel and use that instead ?   Without this guidance or at a few use cases to walk through I think the IG is incomplete.
column17: add guidance on how to use the IG artifacts

column16:
Primary logical models defined as part of this Implementation Guide

The definition of OccupationalDataForHealth is incorrect.

column14: The potential for exposure to Occupational Hazard(s) related to an Occupation and/or an Industry can change over time, and a person could have been in and out of their Usual Work over time, so additional data are helpful to fully evaluate the possible impact of the person’s Usual Work on their health and guide appropriate use of screening tests to detect early disease. Example: a person has worked for a total of 30 years as a ‘secretary’ (Occupation), but in various industries, mostly hotel construction. Her Usual Occupation is ‘secretary’ and her Usual Industry is ‘hotel construction.’ Usual Work does not include work that was unpaid or voluntary.
column15: The potential for exposure to Occupational Hazard(s) related to an Occupation and/or an Industry can change over time, and a person could have been in and out of their Usual Work over time, so additional data are helpful to fully evaluate the possible impact of the person’s Usual Work on their health and guide appropriate use of screening tests to detect early disease. Example: a person has worked for a total of 30 years as a building carpenter (Occupation), but in various Industries, mostly hotel construction. Her Usual Occupation is ‘building carpenter’ and her Usual Industry is 'hotel construction.' Usual Work does not include work that was unpaid or voluntary.

column14: While this profile is specified for the US Realm, the design is intended to support international needs. Three of the referenced value sets supporting Occupation, Industry, and Supervisory Level are necessarily US specific, and the remaining three supporting Work Schedule, Employment Status, and Work Classification are defined to support international concepts.
column16:
Home - Questions for Reviewers

Has there been consideration r/t the amount of PTO (personal Time Off ) available to the patient and how much they use/loose?  The use for international triggered my question. The US compared to some European countries have a large gap in available time.

Logical Model - RetirementDateModel

Has there been any discussion on patient planned retirement (future date)?
Retirement likely results in changes in income and healthcare. Is the patient preparing or anticipating the need to adapt?

Value Sets

The value sets tab lists only yes / No. Should it not also list the value sets found on the logical model tab, the terminology bindings? At a minimum Usual Industry. 
Value Set Code PHVS_Industry_CDC_Census2010
Value Set Name Industry CDC Census 2010
Value Set OID 2.16.840.1.114222.4.11.7187

column14:
PersonEmploymentStatus definition:

The self-reported current and historical data about a person’s economic relationship to work (e.g. having one or more jobs), including start and end dates. A person’s Employment Status could change over time, for example, a person could be employed following a period of choosing to not be in the labor force. Outside of ODH, the employment arrangement between an employer and a person (one job) has sometimes been referred to as a person’s ‘employment status.’ However, in ODH Employment Status is used to characterize a person, Work Classification is used to characterize a job, and Retirement Date is used to characterize a person as retired.
column15: The self-reported current or historical status about a person’s economic relationship to work (e.g. having one or more jobs), including start and end dates.

column14:
Retirement date description: 
..........
However, in ODH Employment Status is used to characterize a person’s relationship to working (e.g., employed, unemployed) and Retirement Date is used to characterize whether or not a person self-identifies as retired. For example, a person could be ‘employed’ (Employment Status) and have retired from a previous job (recorded at the Person level as a Retirement Date).

UsualWork

this seems like an odd example to use as you still wouldn't expect the secretary to be at the construction site.  I think the point is more valid if you pick an industry where the person would have an exposure at their work that is not expected for their occupation.  therefore, i would suggest changing the industry to an enterprise such as a power plant or an indoor firing range or boat construction, or a mine operation to illustrate the point.

column14: The incorporation of self-reported ODH into Electronic health records (EHRs) and other IT healthcare systems provides an opportunity to improve health in relation to work.
column15: The incorporation of self-reported ODH into Electronic Health Records (EHR) and other IT healthcare systems provides an opportunity to improve health in relation to work.
column16: Capitalize Electronic Healh Records

column14: ODH has not been broadly recognized as a social determinate of health and has not yet been a priority for inclusion in IT healthcare systems in a structured way that fully supports direct patient care and occupational public health activities.
column15: ODH has not been broadly recognized as a social determinant of health and has not yet been a priority for inclusion in IT healthcare systems in a structured way that fully supports direct patient care and occupational public health activities.
column16: Change determinate to determinant
